Itinerary.day1: Rishikesh 1-Day Trip Plan (Most Important Places)
Itinerary.day2: Rishikesh 2-Day Trip Plan (Next Most Important Places)
Itinerary.day3: Rishikesh 3-Day Trip Plan (Additional Important / Outskirts)

Itinerary.day1: This plan covers the absolute must-see places in Rishikesh, arranged in a time-efficient sequence for a fulfilling single-day visit.
Itinerary.day2: If you have two days, you can expand on the core experiences of Day 1 by adding more natural beauty and adventure or deeper spiritual exploration.
Itinerary.day3: This plan (which was previously provided in detail) expands your Rishikesh experience to include more distant but highly scenic and significant locations, enriching your journey.

Itinerary.day2: Day 1: (As per the 1-Day Plan)
Itinerary.day3: Day 1: (As per the 2-Day Plan)

Itinerary.day1: Morning: Spiritual Dawn & Ganges Immersion (7:00 AM – 12:00 PM)

Itinerary.day2: Triveni Ghat, Bharat Mandir
Itinerary.day3: Triveni Ghat, Bharat Mandir

Itinerary.day1: 7:00 AM – 8:30 AM: Triveni Ghat & Bharat Mandir
Itinerary.day2: Ram Jhula, Parmarth Niketan Ashram, Laxman Jhula, Trimbakeshwar Temple
Itinerary.day3: Ram Jhula, Parmarth Niketan Ashram, Laxman Jhula, Trimbakeshwar Temple

Itinerary.day1: Start your day with a peaceful dip in the holy Ganges at Triveni Ghat, a significant bathing spot. Witness the morning rituals and serene atmosphere.
Itinerary.day2: Chaurasi Kutia (Beatles Ashram)
Itinerary.day3: Chaurasi Kutia (Beatles Ashram)

Itinerary.day1: Visit the ancient Bharat Mandir, located right next to Triveni Ghat.
Itinerary.day2: Evening Ganga Aarti at Parmarth Niketan.
Itinerary.day3: Evening Ganga Aarti at Parmarth Niketan.

Itinerary.day1: Essentials: Remove footwear before entering the ghat area; maintain cleanliness.
Itinerary.day2: Day 2: Nature, Adventure & Serenity (Next most important)
Itinerary.day3: Day 2: (As per the 2-Day Plan above)

Itinerary.day1: Transportation: From Indermani Badoni Chowk (Natraj Chowk), Triveni Ghat is approximately 1 km (Auto: ₹140, Cab: ₹400, Bike: ₹30).
8:30 AM – 9:30 AM: Breakfast
Itinerary.day2: Morning: Waterfall & Nature (8:00 AM – 1:00 PM)
Itinerary.day3: Neer Garh Waterfall

Itinerary.day1: Enjoy a local breakfast near Triveni Ghat or try a refreshing lassi from Pappu Lassi Wala (near Main Bazar Rd, Mayakund).
Itinerary.day2: 8:00 AM – 11:00 AM: Neer Garh Waterfall
Itinerary.day3: Tapovan area (cafes, shopping)

Itinerary.day1: 9:30 AM – 10:00 AM: Travel to Ram Jhula Area
Itinerary.day2: Take an auto or scooter from the Laxman Jhula area to Neer Garh Waterfall (approx. 5 km, auto + short trek). Enjoy the natural beauty and the refreshing pools.
Itinerary.day3: Adventure option: Bungee Jumping/Giant Swing OR Serenity option: Vashistha Gufa

Itinerary.day1: Take an auto or e-rickshaw towards the Ram Jhula area.
Itinerary.day2: Essentials: Wear comfortable trekking shoes; carry water.
Itinerary.day3: Local market and dinner.

Itinerary.day1: 10:00 AM – 12:00 PM: Parmarth Niketan Ashram & Ram Jhula
Itinerary.day2: 11:00 AM – 1:00 PM: Tapovan Area & Brunch
Itinerary.day3: Day 3: Hilltop Views & Wildlife/Spiritual Excursion (Lesser priority / Further out)

Itinerary.day1: Explore Parmarth Niketan Ashram, Rishikesh's largest ashram. Experience its tranquil environment and visit the temples within.
Itinerary.day2: Return from the waterfall and have brunch at one of the lovely cafes in the Tapovan area. You can try Shambala Cafe, Ira’s Kitchen & Tea Room, or Beatles Cafe for healthy and tasty options.

Itinerary.day1: Walk across the famous Ram Jhula bridge, enjoying the scenic views of the Ganges.
Itinerary.day2: Take some time to explore this area known for its yoga and meditation centers.
Itinerary.day3: Morning: Sunrise Views (Requires very early departure, e.g., 5:00 AM)

Itinerary.day1: Afternoon: Iconic Bridges & Beatles Heritage (12:00 PM – 5:00 PM)
Itinerary.day2: Afternoon: Adventure or Secluded Meditation (1:00 PM – 6:00 PM)
Itinerary.day3: 5:00 AM – 10:00 AM: Kunjapuri Devi Temple

Itinerary.day2: Option A: Adventure Thrill (if interested)
Itinerary.day3: Start very early to drive uphill to Kunjapuri Devi Temple (approx. 25 km from Rishikesh). Witness breathtaking sunrise views over the Himalayas and the Ganges valley, and seek blessings.

Itinerary.day1: 12:00 PM – 1:00 PM: Laxman Jhula & Trimbakeshwar Temple
Itinerary.day2: Head to Jumpin Heights in Mohanchatti (approx. 15 km from Rishikesh) for Bungee Jumping or the Giant Swing. This is a thrilling experience.
Itinerary.day3: Essentials: Wear comfortable shoes; carry warm clothes; requires an early start.

Itinerary.day1: Walk from Ram Jhula to Laxman Jhula, another iconic suspension bridge over the Ganges.
Itinerary.day2: Note: Allocate 3-4 hours for this, including travel and activity.
Itinerary.day3: 10:00 AM – 1:00 PM: Neelkanth Mahadev Temple

Itinerary.day1: Visit the 13-story Trimbakeshwar Temple (Tera Manzil Temple), located near Laxman Jhula.
Itinerary.day2: Option B: Peaceful Contemplation
Itinerary.day3: Travel to Neelkanth Mahadev Temple (approx. 30 km from Rishikesh, a scenic drive). Pay homage at this sacred Shiva temple, nestled amidst dense forests.

Itinerary.day1: Essentials: Be cautious of monkeys; walk on the left; avoid overcrowding. Remove shoes before entering temples.
Itinerary.day2: Visit Vashistha Gufa (near Shivpuri, approx. 20-25 km from Rishikesh). This is a serene meditation cave where Sage Vashistha is believed to have meditated. Ideal for those seeking peace and spiritual depth.
Itinerary.day3: Essentials: Dress modestly; remove footwear; be prepared for winding roads.

Itinerary.day1: 1:00 PM – 2:00 PM: Lunch
Itinerary.day2: Essentials: Maintain silence inside; remove shoes before entering.
Itinerary.day3: Afternoon: Wildlife or Deep Spirituality (Choose one based on interest)

Itinerary.day1: Have lunch in the Laxman Jhula/Tapovan area. Options include The 60's Cafe, Little Buddha Cafe, or Uttar Dakshin for South Indian cuisine.
Itinerary.day2: Evening: Local Market & Dinner (6:00 PM onwards)
Itinerary.day3: Option A: Wildlife Safari

Itinerary.day1: 2:00 PM – 2:30 PM: Travel to Beatles Ashram
Itinerary.day2: Stroll through Rishikesh's local markets like Bada Bazaar or Gole Market for local handicrafts, spiritual items, or clothing.
Itinerary.day3: Visit Rajaji National Park (Chilla Range) (approx. 15 km from Rishikesh). Enjoy a jeep safari to spot elephants, deer, and various bird species.

Itinerary.day1: Take an auto or scooter to Chaurasi Kutia (Beatles Ashram).
Itinerary.day2: For dinner, consider a rooftop experience at The Sitting Elephant or fine dining at Jal & Jalebi by Ganges for special vegetarian options.
Itinerary.day3: Note: Jeep safari slots are fixed (morning/afternoon); ensure booking in advance.

Itinerary.day1: 2:30 PM – 4:30 PM: Explore Chaurasi Kutia (Beatles Ashram)
Itinerary.day3: Option B: Tranquil Retreat

Itinerary.day1: Discover this unique and historic abandoned ashram, famous for hosting The Beatles. Explore its meditation huts and artistic graffiti.
Itinerary.day3: Explore Phool Chatti Ashram or Jhilmil Gufa for quiet meditation and a deeper spiritual experience. These are less commercialized and offer a serene environment.

Itinerary.day1: Essentials: Wear comfortable shoes; carry water; there's an entry fee.
Itinerary.day3: Evening: Departure or Leisure

Itinerary.day1: 4:30 PM – 5:00 PM: Return to Parmarth Niketan Area
Itinerary.day3: Return to Rishikesh. Depending on your departure schedule, you can relax at your hotel or enjoy a final meal at a preferred restaurant.

Itinerary.day1: Travel back from Beatles Ashram to the Parmarth Niketan area.
Evening: Grand Ganga Aarti & Leisure (5:00 PM – 8:00 PM)
5:00 PM – 6:30 PM: Leisure / Local Market Stroll
Relax for a bit before the Aarti, or quickly browse the shops around Ram Jhula/Parmarth Niketan.
6:30 PM – 8:00 PM: Ganga Aarti at Parmarth Niketan Ghat

Arrive at Parmarth Niketan's ghat at least 30 minutes before sunset to secure a good spot for the mesmerizing Ganga Aarti ceremony. This spiritual experience with lamps, hymns, and rituals is a must-see.
Essentials: Arrive early for a good view; maintain silence during the ceremony.
